title: OneDrive: Fails to converts the file name from NFD to NFC with `rclone convmv`
body:
<!--

We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

**STOP and READ**
**YOUR POST WILL BE REMOVED IF IT IS LOW QUALITY**:
Please show the effort you've put into solving the problem and please be specific.
People are volunteering their time to help! Low effort posts are not likely to get good answers!

If you think you might have found a bug, try to replicate it with the latest beta (or stable).
The update instructions are available at https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_selfupdate/

If you can still replicate it or just got a question then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

for a quick response instead of filing an issue on this repo.

If nothing else helps, then please fill in the info below which helps us help you.

**DO NOT REDACT** any information except passwords/keys/personal info.

You should use 3 backticks to begin and end your paste to make it readable.

Make sure to include a log obtained with '-vv'.

You can also use '-vv --log-file bug.log' and a service such as https://pastebin.com or https://gist.github.com/

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`



#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
@nielash, here is the issue mentioned in https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/8088#issuecomment-3000197699.
OneDrive supports both NFD and NFC, but it consider them to be the same when renaming and therefore the `rclone convmv` command fails to transform the file name from NFD to NFC.
It also happens when I mount the OneDrive remote and try to rename manually with `mv`.



#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
```
rclone v1.70.1
- os/version: alpine 3.22.0 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 6.11.0-1012-azure (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.24.4
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: none
```


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
Alpine 3.22.0 64 bit (docker image `rclone/rclone`)


#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)
OneDrive


#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```sh
alias rclone='sudo docker run --rm -it -v ./TEST:/data/TEST -v ~/.config/rclone/:/config/rclone rclone/rclone'

mkdir -p TEST
python3 -c "import unicodedata; open(unicodedata.normalize('NFD', 'TEST/√úber'), 'w').close()"
rclone copy ./TEST OneDrive:TEST
rclone convmv OneDrive:TEST --name-transform "all,nfc" -vv
```


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```
2025/06/25 01:39:02 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.70.1" starting with parameters ["rclone" "convmv" "OneDrive:TEST" "--name-transform" "all,nfc" "-vv"]
2025/06/25 01:39:02 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "OneDrive:TEST"
2025/06/25 01:39:02 DEBUG : Using config file from "/config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2025/06/25 01:39:03 DEBUG : UÃàber: transformed to: √úber
2025/06/25 01:39:03 DEBUG : UÃàber: Size and modification time the same (differ by 0s, within tolerance 1s)
2025/06/25 01:39:03 DEBUG : OneDrive root 'TEST': Waiting for checks to finish
2025/06/25 01:39:03 DEBUG : OneDrive root 'TEST': Waiting for transfers to finish
2025/06/25 01:39:03 DEBUG : UÃàber: transformed to: √úber
2025/06/25 01:39:03 DEBUG : UÃàber: transformed to: √úber
2025/06/25 01:39:04 ERROR : UÃàber: Couldn't move: nameAlreadyExists: Name already exists
2025/06/25 01:39:04 INFO  : 
Transferred:              0 B / 0 B, -, 0 B/s, ETA -
Errors:                 1 (retrying may help)
Checks:                 1 / 1, 100%, Listed 2
Elapsed time:         0.6s

2025/06/25 01:39:04 DEBUG : 7 go routines active
2025/06/25 01:39:04 NOTICE: Failed to convmv: nameAlreadyExists: Name already exists
```
